items.title: Hamas says it has agreed to parts of the Gaza peace proposal outlined by Trump
items.standfirst: The plan called for Hamas to return all Israeli hostages and for the Israeli military to begin withdrawing from parts of the Gaza Strip in phases.

items.title: Trump says Hamas is ready for peace and Israel ‘must immediately stop bombing of Gaza’ – live
items.standfirst: Donald Trump welcomes response from Hamas to his Gaza plan despite group saying further negotiations are required over detailsHamas could ask for revisions to Trump Gaza plan, sources and analysts sayUS government shutdown day three: Republicans and Democrats make little progress on dealTrump administration freezes $2.1bn in funds for Chicago transit projectsAs the world waits for Hamas’s response to Donald Trump’s peace plan for Gaza, the US president has issued a new deadline for the militant group of 6pm ET on Sunday.Trump, who on Monday gave Hamas “three or four days” to respond to his ultimatum, said they were being given “one last chance”. He wrote on his Truth Social platform this morning:Every Country has signed on! If this LAST CHANCE agreement is not reached, all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out against Hamas. Continue reading...

items.title: Rep. Adam Smith says "we've got a long way to go" after Hamas partially accepts Trump's plan
items.standfirst: Hamas announced on Friday that it had accepted portions of President Trump's peace plan for Gaza. Plus, the Senate failed to reopen the government after lawmakers voted down two bills. Democratic Rep. Adam Smith of Washington joins "The Takeout" to discuss.
items.content: Hamas announced on Friday that it had accepted portions of President Trump's peace plan for Gaza. Plus, the Senate failed to reopen the government after lawmakers voted down two bills. Democratic Rep. Adam Smith of Washington joins "The Takeout" to discuss.

items.title: Donald Trump orders Israel to ‘immediately’ stop bombing Gaza as Hamas agrees to free hostages
items.standfirst: Palestinian militant group accepts part of US president’s plan but seeks further negotiations on many termsDonald Trump ordered Israel to “immediately” stop bombing Gaza as he welcomed Hamas’s partial acceptance of his ultimatum to end the nearly two-year war.Hamas has agreed to release all hostages in return for Palestinian prisoners held in Israeli jails, as well as surrender governing power in the Gaza Strip, in accordance with Trump’s plan. Continue reading...
items.content: Palestinian militant group accepts part of US president’s plan but seeks further negotiations on many termsDonald Trump ordered Israel to “immediately” stop bombing Gaza as he welcomed Hamas’s partial acceptance of his ultimatum to end the nearly two-year war.Hamas has agreed to release all hostages in return for Palestinian prisoners held in Israeli jails, as well as surrender governing power in the Gaza Strip, in accordance with Trump’s plan. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump orders Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas accepts peace plan
items.standfirst: Hamas responded to US President Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan to end the war in Gaza on Friday, after the president issued the group an ultimatum to answer by Sunday evening. Hamas announced that it was willing to release hostages, but said some elements of the plan would need to be further discussed.
items.content: Hamas responded to US President Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan to end the war in Gaza on Friday, after the president issued the group an ultimatum to answer by Sunday evening. Hamas announced that it was willing to release hostages, but said some elements of the plan would need to be further discussed.

items.title: Hamas agrees to release hostages under Trump's Gaza plan, other points need negotiating
items.standfirst: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.
items.content: Hamas on Friday said it was willing to release all hostages held in Gaza under the terms of US President Donald Trump's plan to end the Gaza war. Other issues in the peace proposal concerning Gaza's future and the "inalienable rights of the Palestinian people" will need further discussions involving the group's participation. The response came hours after Trump issued a Sunday night ultimatum to Hamas.

items.title: Hamas has sent out 'mixed messages' in response to Trump's peace plan
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump gave Palestinian Hamas militants until Sunday evening to accept his proposal to end the nearly two-year-old war with US ally Israel in the Gaza Strip. "There have been mixed messages from Hamas", said Noga Tarnopolsky, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. A Hamas military leader from Gaza said he opposed the deal, while the political leadership in Qatar said they wanted to look for gray areas, or places where a compromise could be reached, added Tarnopolsky.
items.content: US President Donald Trump gave Palestinian Hamas militants until Sunday evening to accept his proposal to end the nearly two-year-old war with US ally Israel in the Gaza Strip. "There have been mixed messages from Hamas", said Noga Tarnopolsky, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. A Hamas military leader from Gaza said he opposed the deal, while the political leadership in Qatar said they wanted to look for gray areas, or places where a compromise could be reached, added Tarnopolsky.

items.title: Trump tells Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas agrees to release Israeli hostages
items.standfirst: Hamas said it would agree to release the remaining Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. Despite not agreeing to the full U.S. peace proposal, President Trump said the group seemed ready for peace.
items.content: Hamas said it would agree to release the remaining Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. Despite not agreeing to the full U.S. peace proposal, President Trump said the group seemed ready for peace. (Image credit: Bashar Taleb)

items.title: Trump sets Sunday deadline for Hamas to agree to his deal for ending the war in Gaza
items.standfirst: U.S. President Donald Trump said Friday that Hamas must agree to a proposed peace deal by Sunday evening, threatening an even greater military onslaught nearly two years into the war sparked by the Oct. 7 attack into Israel. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.
items.content: U.S. President Donald Trump said Friday that Hamas must agree to a proposed peace deal by Sunday evening, threatening an even greater military onslaught nearly two years into the war sparked by the Oct. 7 attack into Israel. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Jerusalem, Noga Tarnopolsky.

items.title: Egypt foreign minister urges Hamas to accept Trump Gaza plan and disarm
items.standfirst: Hamas reportedly split on response to deal as US president sets Sunday deadline for militant group to replyEgypt and Qatar are working to convince Hamas to accept Donald Trump’s ultimatum to end the war in Gaza, Egypt’s foreign minister has said, as Trump gave a Sunday deadline to reply.Badr Abdelatty said the time had come for Hamas to disarm, and that Israel should be given no excuse to continue its offensive in Gaza, where it killed another 28 Palestinians on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Hamas reportedly split on response to deal as US president sets Sunday deadline for militant group to replyEgypt and Qatar are working to convince Hamas to accept Donald Trump’s ultimatum to end the war in Gaza, Egypt’s foreign minister has said, as Trump gave a Sunday deadline to reply.Badr Abdelatty said the time had come for Hamas to disarm, and that Israel should be given no excuse to continue its offensive in Gaza, where it killed another 28 Palestinians on Friday. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump issues Hamas a Sunday night ultimatum to accept his Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has given Hamas a deadline to agree to his Gaza peace plan. Trump posted on his Truth Social platform on Friday that the agreement must come before Sunday evening or else “all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out”. The plan would place Gaza under a temporary governing committee led by Trump himself and former UK prime minister Tony Blair.
items.content: President Donald Trump has given Hamas a deadline to agree to his Gaza peace plan. Trump posted on his Truth Social platform on Friday that the agreement must come before Sunday evening or else “all HELL, like no one has ever seen before, will break out”. The plan would place Gaza under a temporary governing committee led by Trump himself and former UK prime minister Tony Blair.

items.title: Hamas could ask for revisions to Trump Gaza plan, sources and analysts say
items.standfirst: Turkey and Qatar putting pressure on group to make concessions – but condition it disarm is a sticking pointHamas will demand key revisions to Donald Trump’s Gaza ceasefire proposal but is likely to accept the plan in coming days as a basis for renewed negotiations, analysts and sources close to the group say.Trump imposed a deadline of “three or four days” from Tuesday for Hamas to give its response to his 20-point plan, which aims to bring the two-year war in Gaza to a close and allow an apparently indefinite international administration of the devastated territory, or “pay in hell”. Continue reading...
items.content: Turkey and Qatar putting pressure on group to make concessions – but condition it disarm is a sticking pointHamas will demand key revisions to Donald Trump’s Gaza ceasefire proposal but is likely to accept the plan in coming days as a basis for renewed negotiations, analysts and sources close to the group say.Trump imposed a deadline of “three or four days” from Tuesday for Hamas to give its response to his 20-point plan, which aims to bring the two-year war in Gaza to a close and allow an apparently indefinite international administration of the devastated territory, or “pay in hell”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Hamas accepted parts of Trump's Gaza peace plan, but further negotiations are needed.
Trump urged Israel to stop bombing Gaza after Hamas's response to his plan.
Adam Smith said there is a long way to go after Hamas partially accepted the plan.
Trump gave Hamas a deadline for a final agreement or face consequences.
The Senate failed to reopen the government after lawmakers voted down two bills.

items.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced to more than four years in prison and given $500,000 fine – live updates
items.standfirst: Combs, who was convicted of ‘transportation to engage in prostitution’, sentenced in New YorkThe prosecution submitted several victim impact statements to the court ahead of sentencing, including one from Ventura.“While the jury did not seem to understand or believe that I engaged in freak-offs because of the force and coercion the defendant used against me, I know that is the truth, and his sentence should reflect the reality of the evidence and my lived experience as a victim” Ventura wrote. Continue reading...
items.content: Combs, who was convicted of ‘transportation to engage in prostitution’, sentenced in New YorkThe prosecution submitted several victim impact statements to the court ahead of sentencing, including one from Ventura.“While the jury did not seem to understand or believe that I engaged in freak-offs because of the force and coercion the defendant used against me, I know that is the truth, and his sentence should reflect the reality of the evidence and my lived experience as a victim” Ventura wrote. Continue reading...

items.title: Inside the courtroom as judge sentenced Sean "Diddy" Combs
items.standfirst: A judge on Friday sentenced music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs to four years and two months in prison on prostitution-related charges. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more on the judge's comments while delivering the sentence.
items.content: A judge on Friday sentenced music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs to four years and two months in prison on prostitution-related charges. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more on the judge's comments while delivering the sentence.

items.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced to more than four years in prison on prostitution-related charges
items.standfirst: Federal prosecutors had pushed for a jail term of 11 years and three months of a possible 20 after music mogul’s convictionSean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentencing – live updatesA New York federal judge has sentenced Sean “Diddy” Combs to four years and two months in prison following his conviction this summer on federal prostitution-related charges.The sentencing on Friday in Manhattan came after a federal jury in July acquitted the 55-year-old music mogul of the most serious charges against him – racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking – but found him guilty of two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution. Each count carried a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison. Continue reading...
items.content: Federal prosecutors had pushed for a jail term of 11 years and three months of a possible 20 after music mogul’s convictionSean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentencing – live updatesA New York federal judge has sentenced Sean “Diddy” Combs to four years and two months in prison following his conviction this summer on federal prostitution-related charges.The sentencing on Friday in Manhattan came after a federal jury in July acquitted the 55-year-old music mogul of the most serious charges against him – racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking – but found him guilty of two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution. Each count carried a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced to over four years in prison on prostitution-related charges.
The sentencing hearing occurred three months after his conviction on the charges.
Combs told the court his actions were "disgusting" and "shameful" before sentencing.
The judge sentenced Combs to 50 months in federal prison and a $500,000 fine.
The prosecution submitted victim impact statements to the court before sentencing.

clusters.title: Senate stalemate sends US shutdown into second week
clusters.neutral_headline: US Government Shutdown Continues into Second Week

items.title: Senate stalemate sends US shutdown into second week
items.standfirst: Two separate funding proposals failed on Friday as mass lay-offs and sweeping cuts loom over the government.
items.content: Two separate funding proposals failed on Friday as mass lay-offs and sweeping cuts loom over the government.

items.title: Government shutdown to continue into next week after bills fail in Senate
items.standfirst: The government shutdown will now drag into next week after competing Republican and Democratic measures failed in the Senate on Friday. CBS News congressional correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.
items.content: The government shutdown will now drag into next week after competing Republican and Democratic measures failed in the Senate on Friday. CBS News congressional correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.

items.standfirst: Justices’ order puts on hold lower-court ruing that found officials had wrongly ended temporary protected statusThe US supreme court on Friday allowed Donald Trump’s administration to strip legal protections from more than 300,000 Venezuelan migrants.The justices issued an emergency order, which will last as long as the court case continues, putting on hold a lower-court ruling by US district judge Edward Chen in San Francisco that found the president’s administration had wrongly ended temporary protected status (TPS) for the Venezuelans. items.title: US ‘flying blind’ at critical moment for economy, experts warn, with no jobs data amid shutdown
items.standfirst: Data was collected for closely-watched jobs report before shutdown, but Trump officials so far defy calls to publish itCompanies, consumers, policymakers and investors across the US are “flying blind” at a crucial time for the world’s largest economy, a former top official has warned, after Friday’s closely-watched jobs report was not published as a result of the federal government shutdown.The data for the release have already been collected, according to two former heads of the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). But the Trump administration has so far defied calls to publish the report. Continue reading...

items.title: Israeli military intercepts final aid boat as new flotilla sails to Gaza

items.title: Final boat of 42-strong pro-Palestinian flotilla intercepted by Israel
items.standfirst: Protest vessel intercepted in the early hours of Friday morning 42.5 nautical miles from the coast of GazaThe last boat of the 42 vessels in the Gaza humanitarian flotillathat sought to breach Israel’s 16-year maritime blockade has been intercepted by Israeli forces.A live stream from the Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) had late on Thursday evening shown the Polish-flagged sailing boat Marinette still “sailing strong towards Gaza” after the Israeli government claimed to have halted the flotilla carrying about 500 parliamentarians, lawyers and activists including Greta Thunberg. Continue reading...
items.content: Protest vessel intercepted in the early hours of Friday morning 42.5 nautical miles from the coast of GazaThe last boat of the 42 vessels in the Gaza humanitarian flotillathat sought to breach Israel’s 16-year maritime blockade has been intercepted by Israeli forces.A live stream from the Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) had late on Thursday evening shown the Polish-flagged sailing boat Marinette still “sailing strong towards Gaza” after the Israeli government claimed to have halted the flotilla carrying about 500 parliamentarians, lawyers and activists including Greta Thunberg. Continue reading...

items.content: Israeli forces have intercepted an aid flotilla bound for Gaza that was being closely watched around the world, boarding boats and detaining activists including Greta Thunberg who were seeking to break the blockade of the Palestinian enclave.

items.standfirst: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry. Chris Ceder, one of the report's authors, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.

items.content: The four already deported are Italian citizens, the Israeli foreign ministry says.

Four Gaza flotilla activists were deported by Israel.
The deported activists were Italian citizens.
The Israeli foreign ministry confirmed the deportations.

items.content: Announcement draws criticism from Anglican churches that oppose female bishops.

items.title: Woman is named Archbishop of Canterbury for first time in Church of England history
items.standfirst: Sarah Mullally is the first woman to be named to the post of Archbishop of Canterbury in the history of the Church of England.
items.content: Sarah Mullally is the first woman to be named to the post of Archbishop of Canterbury in the history of the Church of England.

ai_summary: The Church of England has appointed its first female Archbishop of Canterbury.
Sarah Mullally is the first woman to hold the position.
The announcement has drawn criticism from some Anglican churches.
Some Anglican churches oppose female bishops.
The appointment marks a historic change for the Church.

items.content: The terrorist attack on a Manchester synagogue during Yom Kippur, has stoked fears among Britain's Jewish community amid a rise in antisemitism.

items.content: Keir Starmer says Britain must defeat rising antisemitic hatred.

The attack happened during Yom Kippur.

Keir Starmer stated Britain must combat rising antisemitic hatred.

clusters.title: Power outage in Spain and Portugal 'first known blackout caused by excessive voltage'
clusters.neutral_headline: Blackout in Spain and Portugal caused by excessive voltage

items.title: Power outage in Spain and Portugal 'first known blackout caused by excessive voltage'
items.standfirst: A massive power outage which brought much of Spain and Portugal to a standstill earlier this year is the first known blackout caused by excessive voltage, a report has found.
items.content: A massive power outage which brought much of Spain and Portugal to a standstill earlier this year is the first known blackout caused by excessive voltage, a report has found.

items.title: Blackout in Spain and Portugal 'first of its kind', report finds
items.standfirst: The massive blackout that hit the Iberian peninsula is the first known blackout caused by overvoltage.
items.content: The massive blackout that hit the Iberian peninsula is the first known blackout caused by overvoltage.

ai_summary: A massive power outage affected Spain and Portugal earlier this year.
A report found the blackout was caused by excessive voltage.
The blackout is the first known instance of this cause.
The outage brought much of Spain and Portugal to a standstill.
The report details the unique circumstances of the blackout.

clusters.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
clusters.neutral_headline: Treasure hunters recover $1M in coins from shipwreck

items.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
items.standfirst: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...
items.content: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...

items.title: $1M worth of coins recovered in Spanish shipwreck off Florida coast, treasure hunters say
items.standfirst: More than 1,000 silver and gold coins collectively valued at about $1 million were recovered from an 18th-century shipwreck off the coast of Florida, a shipwreck salvage company said
items.content: More than 1,000 silver and gold coins collectively valued at about $1 million were recovered from an 18th-century shipwreck off the coast of Florida, a shipwreck salvage company said

ai_summary: Treasure hunters discovered coins from a Spanish shipwreck.
The shipwreck occurred off the coast of Florida.
The coins are estimated to be worth $1 million.
The coins were from the 18th century.
The salvage company announced the recovery of the coins.
